about.name: Rachit Taneja
about.summary: First-year Computer Science student focused on frontend engineering and AI-driven interfaces.

about.description: I focus on building fast, minimal, and production-ready interfaces using React and modern frontend tooling. I explore AI as an interface layer rather than a black-box solution, emphasizing reliability, scope control, and clean system design.

projects.name: PromptVault
projects.problem: Managing and reusing AI prompts becomes unstructured and error-prone when prompts are mixed across users or use cases.
projects.solution: Built a prompt management tool that isolates prompts per user using localStorage namespaces, enabling clean separation without authentication or backend dependency.
features: Per-user prompt isolation using namespaced localStorage keys
Minimal and distraction-free UI for focused usage
projects.key_learning: Learned how to design user-scoped data systems on the client side and how to balance simplicity with usability in UI design.

projects.name: JavaScript Playground
projects.problem: Core JavaScript concepts are often learned passively without enough hands-on, focused practice.
projects.solution: Created a collection of small, focused JavaScript mini-projects, each designed to reinforce a specific concept through direct interaction.
features: Independent mini-projects targeting individual JavaScript concepts
Hands-on learning instead of theory-heavy explanations
Simple UI to keep focus on logic rather than design complexity
projects.key_learning: Strengthened foundational JavaScript understanding by repeatedly applying concepts in small, isolated problem spaces.
